text: As China rejects American garbage and online retail continues to boom, some paper mills are making a comeback by recycling waste and turning it into cardboard:
author: nbj914

text: "I began to realize how silly and narrow our notion of exceptionalism is — this impulse to consider ourselves somehow immune to the forces that shape the rest of the world." If you can't get out and travel, stay in and spend the night w/ @RickSteves:

text: I'm really excited about the team @Ryanj899 is building for our new investigations desk, bringing in someone for this role, and putting more $$ into journalism that matters. It seems @PacificStand is leveling up every day. Half of my job these days, honestly, is just keeping up.
author: nbj914

text: This is my favorite kind of evidence. (Thanks @jbouie.)
author: nbj914

text: Whether it’s common or not I don’t know, but I think it’s unnecessary in this piece. It’s meant to tell us something about Duca and these rumors? This is how I interact with most of my email.
author: nbj914

text: But does it spark joy? (I create my own systems and spreadsheets, finding most out-of-the-box stuff to be missing one or more things I want. And I digitize almost everything and keep obsessive Drive folders that are auto backed up on both an external and my laptop.)
author: nbj914

text: You'll get to work w/ the best team in journalism. @beccaworby & @ben_c_rowen on enterprise reporting. @sophiemurguia & @Ryanj899 on newsroom standards. And lots of others depending on your interests and skill set. We're all about embracing the latter while developing the former.
author: nbj914

text: I was watching old episodes of To Tell the Truth on YouTube (don't judge) and immediately recognized Jay Sebring as a contestant on one; freaked me out.
author: nbj914

text: I'm biased, but, uh, can I put in a second vote for this one? Elaina crushed it.
author: nbj914

text: Run the best, most careful reporters and editors through a magazine fact check and there will be changes. Maybe you’re not catching legally sensitive or potentially damaging things in this case, but you’re catching things. What does that say about most of what we’re reading?
author: nbj914

text: You all should be cutting this material. I can’t believe it’s still magazines, after all that business has been through, that are holding the line on what fact-checking should look like across the board.
author: nbj914

text: #ff @jonahshai and @sophiemurguia, who both started at @PacificStand today as part of our new investigations desk. And we're still growing. If you want to join, we've got open full-time staff positions and editorial/audience/visual fellowships here:
author: nbj914

text: Did @NYMag scrub the Alex Kotlowitz book excerpt about Ramaine Hill from its site or is something else going on here? These URLs are dead: http://nymag.com/intelligencer/2019/03/ramaine-hill-book-excerpt-alex-kotlowitz-an-american-summer.html … / http://nymag.com/tags/ramaine-hill/ ….
author: nbj914

text: Thread: On blaming "the media" for not covering the threats of climate change as much as you might like them/it to.
author: nbj914

text: I hope all of these bandages keep the sand out—& back to the doctor tomorrow for a check-in—but, 2 weeks after surgery, and 1 week out of the hospital, I’m feeling pretty good. Much love to everyone who has helped prop me up and keep me sane. Summer is here early; hit the beach.
author: nbj914

text: oh! you know he likes to drive.
author: nbj914

text: "We're all falling to the Earth, so what else are you going to do?" https://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2019/03/18/bill-hader-kills …
author: nbj914

text: To get a sense of what our current staff writers do, follow @KateWheeling (https://psmag.com/author/kate-wheeling …), @franciediep (https://psmag.com/author/francie-diep …) & @TomJacobs_PSMag (https://psmag.com/author/tomjacobs …). It's a pretty great gig! Another perk: Our annual retreat this year will be in Yosemite.
author: nbj914

text: We're also hiring a staff writer for @PacificStand. You should have a specific beat in our core coverage areas in mind, on which you'll report/write news, analysis, and a bit of enterprise: https://psmag.com/news/we-are-hiring-a-staff-writer-2019 …. (All of our open positions here: https://psmag.com/tag/hiring .)
author: nbj914

text: "To not be missing forever. That seems important."
author: nbj914

text: This may be the best K-12 media literacy program money can buy, but I think there are lessons here that can be applied to all kinds of schools, and at all age levels:
author: nbj914

text: This comes up at every single conference I attend as a @PacificStand representative. We should do more to teach and encourage more academics to communicate w/ a wide, popular audience. And we should find ways for the academy to value those contributions.
author: nbj914

text: We did a short one two years ago: https://psmag.com/magazine/countrys-first-somali-american-legislator-and-her-politics-of-inclusivity …
author: nbj914

text: #ff @throwin_shadows and @Ted_Scheinman, who will represent @PacificStand at the @ASME1963 dinner tomorrow, where we're nominated for @TereseMarieM's essay "Surviving Racism." Bring it home! (Wish I could be there. Had to cancel my trip last-minute for an emergency appendectomy.)
author: nbj914

text: "It's better to watch A Clockwork Orange than to be one." On wrestling with difficult art in the age of cancellation:
author: nbj914

text: That's the point.
author: nbj914

text: If you want to work w/ me, Old Man Internet, we're hiring an accountability reporter for our new investigations desk, to work w/ new hires @jonahshai and @sophiemurguia; an assistant editor for social; & fellows in editorial, visual, and engagement. Info: https://psmag.com/tag/hiring
author: nbj914

text: You guys: Text, in sentences, sometimes paragraphs, on an article page is still often the best way to tell a story. Use other tools when you should, or to find & engage new audiences, but never just bc you can—and make sure there's revenue built in when those tools are expensive.
author: nbj914

text: I still blame Snow Fall. And I'm only kind of kidding.
author: nbj914

text: Update: After 7 days in the hospital, I'm finally home, but w/ a long list of potential complications that could send me back and facing 2+ more weeks of recovery. My to-do list has gone from 250 work-related items to "try to eat 5 crackers today." Take care of yourselves, folks.
author: nbj914

text: Wish it were that simple. Was supposed to be out of here days ago. Complications.
author: nbj914

text: Day No. 5 in the hospital with no end yet in sight, but friends and fam have brought all the reinforcements I need.
author: nbj914

text: Thanks bub.
author: nbj914

text: Thanks Carrie!
author: nbj914
